meanings.definition: Impose or collect (a tax or fine)
meanings.sent1: The government levied a tax on all imported goods.
meanings.sent2: The city council levied a fine for parking violations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun levied a tax on all the cookies in the jar.
meanings.sent4: The weight of responsibility levied on his shoulders was heavier than any tax.
meanings.sent5: The teacher levied a homework assignment that felt like a heavy burden on the students.

meanings.definition: Enforce or carry out (a law or decision)
meanings.sent1: The police officer levied the speed limit on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The judge levied a sentence on the criminal.
meanings.sent3: The strict librarian levied a rule that all books must be returned on time.
meanings.sent4: The principal levied consequences on the students who broke the school rules.
meanings.sent5: The referee levied a penalty on the player for unsportsmanlike conduct.
